channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump punted on medical debt protection. Now the battle is in the states
item.description: Some states are enacting medical debt laws as the Trump administration pulls back federal protections. Elsewhere, industry opposition has derailed leg...

item.title: VIDEO: Trump and scientists disagree on Tylenol and autism. Who do Americans believe?
item.description: President Trump linked Tylenol to autism despite little medical evidence. How are Americans meant to make important decisions about their health at th...

item.title: Leucovorin for autism? Many scientists — and parents — are skeptical
item.description: President Trump says an old drug that acts like a vitamin can reduce autism symptoms in many children. The science doesn't support that claim.

item.title: Former special counsel Jack Smith warns that rule of law is 'under attack'
item.description: In his first public remarks since leaving the Justice Department, Smith said he's sad and angry about the dismissals of career public servants and the...

item.title: Dallas ICE shooting updates. And, Trump threatens layoffs amid looming shutdown.
item.description: Federal authorities say the shooting at an ICE detention facility was "targeted violence." And, the White House threatens layoffs if the government sh...

item.title: RadioShack buyers ran a Ponzi scheme, SEC alleges
item.description: The buyers of distressed brick-and-mortar companies like RadioShack and Modell's Sporting Goods, are accused of running a Ponzi scheme.

item.title: Australian film altered in China to make gay couple straight
item.description: A scene featuring a same-sex couple was digitally altered to depict a heterosexual couple.

item.title: U.S. GDP expanded at a surprising 3.8% pace in 2nd-quarter revision
item.description: The U.S. economy's 3.8% growth from April through June represents a dramatic upgrade of the government's previous estimate.

item.title: Former French president Sarkozy given five-year sentence after Libya case
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy, president from 2007-12, was found guilty of criminal conspiracy but cleared of other charges.

item.title: Lice concerns rise with kids at school. What to know about prevention, treatment.
item.description: Lice cannot hop, jump or fly. The most common way to get lice is through head-to-head contact with someone who already has them, according to experts.

item.title: Billy Crudup reflects on career risks that led to role in "The Morning Show"
item.description: Billy Crudup talks to Anthony Mason about his Emmy-winning turn as Cory Ellison in "The Morning Show," how risk-taking shaped his career and why he ne...

item.title: Over 1,000 children fall ill from free school lunches in Indonesia
item.description: The government's multi-billion-dollar "nutritious meals programme" has been plagued by food poisoning.

item.title: Palestinians in West Bank stranded as Israel shuts only international crossing
item.description: Many have been unable to leave the territory since the Allenby Bridge crossing was shut indefinitely on Wednesday.

item.title: Palestinians in West Bank stranded as Israel shuts only international crossing
item.description: Many have been unable to leave the territory since the Allenby Bridge crossing was shut indefinitely on Wednesday.

item.title: Richard Grenell discusses lineup for Kennedy Center Honors
item.description: This year's Kennedy Center Honors will be hosted by President Trump in December and broadcast on CBS. Honorees include Sylvester Stallone, George Stra...

item.title: Trump’s touting of an unproven autism drug surprised many, including the doctor who proposed it
1 detainee killed and 2 others critically injured in Dallas ICE facility, Homeland Security says
item.description: Authorities say a shooter with a rifle opened fire from a roof onto a U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement location in Dallas.
